fields.description: Clockwise rotation angle of the background fill in degrees; 0-359

types.name: BackgroundFillFreeformGradient
types.description: The background is a freeform gradient that rotates after every message in the chat.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background fill, always “freeform_gradient”

fields.name: colors
fields.description: A list of the 3 or 4 base colors that are used to generate the freeform gradient in the RGB24 format

types.name: BackgroundType
types.description: This object describes the type of a background. Currently, it can be one of

types.name: BackgroundTypeFill
types.description: The background is automatically filled based on the selected colors.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background, always “fill”

fields.name: fill
fields.description: The background fill

fields.name: dark_theme_dimming
fields.description: Dimming of the background in dark themes, as a percentage; 0-100

types.name: BackgroundTypeWallpaper
types.description: The background is a wallpaper in the JPEG format.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background, always “wallpaper”

fields.name: document
fields.description: Document with the wallpaper

fields.name: dark_theme_dimming
fields.description: Dimming of the background in dark themes, as a percentage; 0-100

fields.name: is_blurred
fields.description: Optional. True, if the wallpaper is downscaled to fit in a 450x450 square and then box-blurred with radius 12

fields.name: is_moving
fields.description: Optional. True, if the background moves slightly when the device is tilted

types.name: BackgroundTypePattern
types.description: The background is a .PNG or .TGV (gzipped subset of SVG with MIME type “application/x-tgwallpattern”) pattern to be combined with the background fill chosen by the user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background, always “pattern”

fields.name: document
fields.description: Document with the pattern

fields.name: fill
fields.description: The background fill that is combined with the pattern

fields.name: intensity
fields.description: Intensity of the pattern when it is shown above the filled background; 0-100

fields.name: is_inverted
fields.description: Optional. True, if the background fill must be applied only to the pattern itself. All other pixels are black in this case. For dark themes only

fields.name: is_moving
fields.description: Optional. True, if the background moves slightly when the device is tilted

types.name: BackgroundTypeChatTheme
types.description: The background is taken directly from a built-in chat theme.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background, always “chat_theme”

fields.name: theme_name
fields.description: Name of the chat theme, which is usually an emoji

types.name: ChatBackground
types.description: This object represents a chat background.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background

types.name: ForumTopicCreated
types.description: This object represents a service message about a new forum topic created in the chat.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the topic

fields.name: icon_color
fields.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

fields.name: is_name_implicit
fields.description: Optional. True, if the name of the topic wasn't specified explicitly by its creator and likely needs to be changed by the bot

types.name: ForumTopicClosed
types.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic closed in the chat. Currently holds no information.

types.name: ForumTopicEdited
types.description: This object represents a service message about an edited forum topic.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Optional. New name of the topic, if it was edited

fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. New identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon, if it was edited; an empty string if the icon was removed

types.name: ForumTopicReopened
types.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic reopened in the chat. Currently holds no information.

types.name: GeneralForumTopicHidden
types.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic hidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

types.name: GeneralForumTopicUnhidden
types.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic unhidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

types.name: SharedUser
types.description: This object contains information about a user that was shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestUsers button.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Identifier of the shared user. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so 64-bit integers or double-precision float types are safe for storing these identifiers. The bot may not have access to the user and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the user is already known to the bot by some other means.

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: Optional. First name of the user, if the name was requested by the bot

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. Last name of the user, if the name was requested by the bot

fields.name: username
fields.description: Optional. Username of the user, if the username was requested by the bot

fields.name: photo
fields.description: Optional. Available sizes of the chat photo, if the photo was requested by the bot

types.name: UsersShared
types.description: This object contains information about the users whose identifiers were shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestUsers button.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Identifier of the request

fields.name: users
fields.description: Information about users shared with the bot.

types.name: ChatShared
types.description: This object contains information about a chat that was shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestChat button.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Identifier of the request

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Identifier of the shared chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the chat and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the chat is already known to the bot by some other means.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title of the chat, if the title was requested by the bot.

fields.name: username
fields.description: Optional. Username of the chat, if the username was requested by the bot and available.

fields.name: photo
fields.description: Optional. Available sizes of the chat photo, if the photo was requested by the bot

types.name: WriteAccessAllowed
types.description: This object represents a service message about a user allowing a bot to write messages after adding it to the attachment menu, launching a Web App from a link, or accepting an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method requestWriteAccess.

fields.name: from_request
fields.description: Optional. True, if the access was granted after the user accepted an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method requestWriteAccess

fields.name: web_app_name
fields.description: Optional. Name of the Web App, if the access was granted when the Web App was launched from a link

fields.name: from_attachment_menu
fields.description: Optional. True, if the access was granted when the bot was added to the attachment or side menu

types.name: VideoChatScheduled
types.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat scheduled in the chat.

fields.name: start_date
fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the video chat is supposed to be started by a chat administrator

types.name: VideoChatStarted
types.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat started in the chat. Currently holds no information.

types.name: VideoChatEnded
types.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat ended in the chat.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Video chat duration in seconds

types.name: VideoChatParticipantsInvited
types.description: This object represents a service message about new members invited to a video chat.

fields.name: users
fields.description: New members that were invited to the video chat

types.name: PaidMessagePriceChanged
types.description: Describes a service message about a change in the price of paid messages within a chat.

fields.name: paid_message_star_count
fields.description: The new number of Telegram Stars that must be paid by non-administrator users of the supergroup chat for each sent message

types.name: DirectMessagePriceChanged
types.description: Describes a service message about a change in the price of direct messages sent to a channel chat.

fields.name: are_direct_messages_enabled
fields.description: True, if direct messages are enabled for the channel chat; false otherwise

fields.name: direct_message_star_count
fields.description: Optional. The new number of Telegram Stars that must be paid by users for each direct message sent to the channel. Does not apply to users who have been exempted by administrators. Defaults to 0.

types.name: SuggestedPostApproved
types.description: Describes a service message about the approval of a suggested post.

fields.name: suggested_post_message
fields.description: Optional. Message containing the suggested post. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain the reply_to_message field even if it itself is a reply.

fields.name: price
fields.description: Optional. Amount paid for the post

fields.name: send_date
fields.description: Date when the post will be published

types.name: SuggestedPostApprovalFailed
types.description: Describes a service message about the failed approval of a suggested post. Currently, only caused by insufficient user funds at the time of approval.

fields.name: suggested_post_message
fields.description: Optional. Message containing the suggested post whose approval has failed. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain the reply_to_message field even if it itself is a reply.

fields.name: price
fields.description: Expected price of the post

types.name: SuggestedPostDeclined
types.description: Describes a service message about the rejection of a suggested post.

fields.name: suggested_post_message
fields.description: Optional. Message containing the suggested post. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain the reply_to_message field even if it itself is a reply.

fields.name: comment
fields.description: Optional. Comment with which the post was declined

types.name: SuggestedPostPaid
types.description: Describes a service message about a successful payment for a suggested post.

fields.name: suggested_post_message
fields.description: Optional. Message containing the suggested post. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain the reply_to_message field even if it itself is a reply.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency in which the payment was made. Currently, one of “XTR” for Telegram Stars or “TON” for toncoins

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Optional. The amount of the currency that was received by the channel in nanotoncoins; for payments in toncoins only

fields.name: star_amount
fields.description: Optional. The amount of Telegram Stars that was received by the channel; for payments in Telegram Stars only

types.name: SuggestedPostRefunded
types.description: Describes a service message about a payment refund for a suggested post.

fields.name: suggested_post_message
fields.description: Optional. Message containing the suggested post. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain the reply_to_message field even if it itself is a reply.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: Reason for the refund. Currently, one of “post_deleted” if the post was deleted within 24 hours of being posted or removed from scheduled messages without being posted, or “payment_refunded” if the payer refunded their payment.

types.name: GiveawayCreated
types.description: This object represents a service message about the creation of a scheduled giveaway.

fields.name: prize_star_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of Telegram Stars to be split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

types.name: Giveaway
types.description: This object represents a message about a scheduled giveaway.

fields.name: chats
fields.description: The list of chats which the user must join to participate in the giveaway

fields.name: winners_selection_date
fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when winners of the giveaway will be selected

fields.name: winner_count
fields.description: The number of users which are supposed to be selected as winners of the giveaway

fields.name: only_new_members
fields.description: Optional. True, if only users who join the chats after the giveaway started should be eligible to win

fields.name: has_public_winners
fields.description: Optional. True, if the list of giveaway winners will be visible to everyone

fields.name: prize_description
fields.description: Optional. Description of additional giveaway prize

fields.name: country_codes
fields.description: Optional. A list of two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes indicating the countries from which eligible users for the giveaway must come. If empty, then all users can participate in the giveaway. Users with a phone number that was bought on Fragment can always participate in giveaways.

fields.name: prize_star_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of Telegram Stars to be split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

fields.name: premium_subscription_month_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of months the Telegram Premium subscription won from the giveaway will be active for; for Telegram Premium giveaways only

types.name: GiveawayWinners
types.description: This object represents a message about the completion of a giveaway with public winners.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: The chat that created the giveaway

fields.name: giveaway_message_id
fields.description: Identifier of the message with the giveaway in the chat

fields.name: winners_selection_date
fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when winners of the giveaway were selected

fields.name: winner_count
fields.description: Total number of winners in the giveaway

fields.name: winners
fields.description: List of up to 100 winners of the giveaway

fields.name: additional_chat_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of other chats the user had to join in order to be eligible for the giveaway

fields.name: prize_star_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of Telegram Stars that were split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

fields.name: premium_subscription_month_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of months the Telegram Premium subscription won from the giveaway will be active for; for Telegram Premium giveaways only

fields.name: unclaimed_prize_count
fields.description: Optional. Number of undistributed prizes

fields.name: only_new_members
fields.description: Optional. True, if only users who had joined the chats after the giveaway started were eligible to win

fields.name: was_refunded
fields.description: Optional. True, if the giveaway was canceled because the payment for it was refunded

fields.name: prize_description
fields.description: Optional. Description of additional giveaway prize

types.name: GiveawayCompleted
types.description: This object represents a service message about the completion of a giveaway without public winners.

fields.name: winner_count
fields.description: Number of winners in the giveaway

fields.name: unclaimed_prize_count
fields.description: Optional. Number of undistributed prizes

fields.name: giveaway_message
fields.description: Optional. Message with the giveaway that was completed, if it wasn't deleted

fields.name: is_star_giveaway
fields.description: Optional. True, if the giveaway is a Telegram Star giveaway. Otherwise, currently, the giveaway is a Telegram Premium giveaway.

types.name: LinkPreviewOptions
types.description: Describes the options used for link preview generation.

fields.name: is_disabled
fields.description: Optional. True, if the link preview is disabled

fields.name: url
fields.description: Optional. URL to use for the link preview. If empty, then the first URL found in the message text will be used

fields.name: prefer_small_media
fields.description: Optional. True, if the media in the link preview is supposed to be shrunk; ignored if the URL isn't explicitly specified or media size change isn't supported for the preview

fields.name: prefer_large_media
fields.description: Optional. True, if the media in the link preview is supposed to be enlarged; ignored if the URL isn't explicitly specified or media size change isn't supported for the preview

fields.name: show_above_text
fields.description: Optional. True, if the link preview must be shown above the message text; otherwise, the link preview will be shown below the message text

types.name: SuggestedPostPrice
types.description: Describes the price of a suggested post.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency in which the post will be paid. Currently, must be one of “XTR” for Telegram Stars or “TON” for toncoins

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of the currency that will be paid for the post in the smallest units of the currency, i.e. Telegram Stars or nanotoncoins. Currently, price in Telegram Stars must be between 5 and 100000, and price in nanotoncoins must be between 10000000 and 10000000000000.

types.name: SuggestedPostInfo
types.description: Contains information about a suggested post.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State of the suggested post. Currently, it can be one of “pending”, “approved”, “declined”.

fields.name: price
fields.description: Optional. Proposed price of the post. If the field is omitted, then the post is unpaid.

fields.name: send_date
fields.description: Optional. Proposed send date of the post. If the field is omitted, then the post can be published at any time within 30 days at the sole discretion of the user or administrator who approves it.

types.name: SuggestedPostParameters
types.description: Contains parameters of a post that is being suggested by the bot.

fields.name: price
fields.description: Optional. Proposed price for the post. If the field is omitted, then the post is unpaid.

fields.name: send_date
fields.description: Optional. Proposed send date of the post. If specified, then the date must be between 300 second and 2678400 seconds (30 days) in the future. If the field is omitted, then the post can be published at any time within 30 days at the sole discretion of the user who approves it.

types.name: DirectMessagesTopic
types.description: Describes a topic of a direct messages chat.

fields.name: topic_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the topic. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Optional. Information about the user that created the topic. Currently, it is always present

types.name: UserProfilePhotos
types.description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

fields.name: total_count
fields.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

fields.name: photos
fields.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

types.name: UserProfileAudios
types.description: This object represents the audios displayed on a user's profile.

fields.name: total_count
fields.description: Total number of profile audios for the target user

fields.name: audios
fields.description: Requested profile audios

types.name: File
types.description:
This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile.

The maximum file size to download is 20 MB

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

fields.name: file_path
fields.description: Optional. File path. Use https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path> to get the file.

types.name: WebAppInfo
types.description: Describes a Web App.

fields.name: url
fields.description: An HTTPS URL of a Web App to be opened with additional data as specified in Initializing Web Apps

types.name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
types.description: This object represents a custom keyboard with reply options (see Introduction to bots for details and examples). Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: keyboard
fields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of KeyboardButton objects

fields.name: is_persistent
fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to always show the keyboard when the regular keyboard is hidden. Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard can be hidden and opened with a keyboard icon.

fields.name: resize_keyboard
fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

fields.name: one_time_keyboard
fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat - the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to false.

fields.name: input_field_placeholder
fields.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters

fields.name: selective
fields.description:
Optional. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.

Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

types.name: KeyboardButton
types.description: This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. At most one of the fields other than text, icon_custom_emoji_id, and style must be used to specify the type of the button. For simple text buttons, String can be used instead of this object to specify the button text.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text of the button. If none of the fields other than text, icon_custom_emoji_id, and style are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed

fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown before the text of the button. Can only be used by bots that purchased additional usernames on Fragment or in the messages directly sent by the bot to private, group and supergroup chats if the owner of the bot has a Telegram Premium subscription.

fields.name: style
fields.description: Optional. Style of the button. Must be one of “danger” (red), “success” (green) or “primary” (blue). If omitted, then an app-specific style is used.

fields.name: request_users
fields.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable users. Identifiers of selected users will be sent to the bot in a “users_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_chat
fields.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable chats. Tapping on a chat will send its identifier to the bot in a “chat_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_contact
fields.description: Optional. If True, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_location
fields.description: Optional. If True, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_poll
fields.description: Optional. If specified, the user will be asked to create a poll and send it to the bot when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: web_app
fields.description: Optional. If specified, the described Web App will be launched when the button is pressed. The Web App will be able to send a “web_app_data” service message. Available in private chats only.

types.name: KeyboardButtonRequestUsers
types.description: This object defines the criteria used to request suitable users. Information about the selected users will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. More about requesting users »

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request that will be received back in the UsersShared object. Must be unique within the message

fields.name: user_is_bot
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request bots, pass False to request regular users. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: user_is_premium
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request premium users, pass False to request non-premium users. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: max_quantity
fields.description: Optional. The maximum number of users to be selected; 1-10. Defaults to 1.

fields.name: request_name
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the users' first and last names

fields.name: request_username
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the users' usernames

fields.name: request_photo
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the users' photos

types.name: KeyboardButtonRequestChat
types.description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable chat. Information about the selected chat will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. The bot will be granted requested rights in the chat if appropriate. More about requesting chats ».

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the ChatShared object. Must be unique within the message

fields.name: chat_is_channel
fields.description: Pass True to request a channel chat, pass False to request a group or a supergroup chat.

fields.name: chat_is_forum
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a forum supergroup, pass False to request a non-forum chat. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: chat_has_username
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a supergroup or a channel with a username, pass False to request a chat without a username. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: chat_is_created
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat owned by the user. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: user_administrator_rights
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the user in the chat. The rights must be a superset of bot_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: bot_administrator_rights
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the bot in the chat. The rights must be a subset of user_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: bot_is_member
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat with the bot as a member. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: request_title
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the chat's title

fields.name: request_username
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the chat's username

fields.name: request_photo
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the chat's photo

types.name: KeyboardButtonPollType
types.description: This object represents type of a poll, which is allowed to be created and sent when the corresponding button is pressed.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Optional. If quiz is passed, the user will be allowed to create only polls in the quiz mode. If regular is passed, only regular polls will be allowed. Otherwise, the user will be allowed to create a poll of any type.

types.name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
types.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see ReplyKeyboardMarkup). Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: remove_keyboard
fields.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use one_time_keyboard in ReplyKeyboardMarkup)

fields.name: selective
fields.description:
Optional. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.

Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

types.name: InlineKeyboardMarkup
types.description: This object represents an inline keyboard that appears right next to the message it belongs to.

fields.name: inline_keyboard
fields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of InlineKeyboardButton objects

types.name: InlineKeyboardButton
types.description: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. Exactly one of the fields other than text, icon_custom_emoji_id, and style must be used to specify the type of the button.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Label text on the button

fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown before the text of the button. Can only be used by bots that purchased additional usernames on Fragment or in the messages directly sent by the bot to private, group and supergroup chats if the owner of the bot has a Telegram Premium subscription.

fields.name: style
fields.description: Optional. Style of the button. Must be one of “danger” (red), “success” (green) or “primary” (blue). If omitted, then an app-specific style is used.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Optional. HTTP or tg:// URL to be opened when the button is pressed. Links tg://user?id=<user_id> can be used to mention a user by their identifier without using a username, if this is allowed by their privacy settings.

fields.name: callback_data
fields.description: Optional. Data to be sent in a callback query to the bot when the button is pressed, 1-64 bytes

fields.name: web_app
fields.description: Optional. Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery. Available only in private chats between a user and the bot. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: login_url
fields.description: Optional. An HTTPS URL used to automatically authorize the user. Can be used as a replacement for the Telegram Login Widget.

fields.name: switch_inline_query
fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. May be empty, in which case just the bot's username will be inserted. Not supported for messages sent in channel direct messages chats and on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat
fields.description:
Optional. If set, pressing the button will insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. May be empty, in which case only the bot's username will be inserted.

This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat - good for selecting something from multiple options. Not supported in channels and for messages sent in channel direct messages chats and on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: switch_inline_query_chosen_chat
fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats of the specified type, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. Not supported for messages sent in channel direct messages chats and on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: copy_text
fields.description: Optional. Description of the button that copies the specified text to the clipboard.

fields.name: callback_game
fields.description:
Optional. Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button.

NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.

fields.name: pay
fields.description:
Optional. Specify True, to send a Pay button. Substrings “” and “XTR” in the buttons's text will be replaced with a Telegram Star icon.

NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row and can only be used in invoice messages.

types.name: LoginUrl
types.description:
This object represents a parameter of the inline keyboard button used to automatically authorize a user. Serves as a great replacement for the Telegram Login Widget when the user is coming from Telegram. All the user needs to do is tap/click a button and confirm that they want to log in:

Telegram apps support these buttons as of version 5.7.

Sample bot: @discussbot

fields.name: url
fields.description:
An HTTPS URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.

NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.

fields.name: forward_text
fields.description: Optional. New text of the button in forwarded messages.

fields.name: bot_username
fields.description: Optional. Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See Setting up a bot for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See Linking your domain to the bot for more details.

fields.name: request_write_access
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

types.name: SwitchInlineQueryChosenChat
types.description: This object represents an inline button that switches the current user to inline mode in a chosen chat, with an optional default inline query.

fields.name: query
fields.description: Optional. The default inline query to be inserted in the input field. If left empty, only the bot's username will be inserted

fields.name: allow_user_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if private chats with users can be chosen

fields.name: allow_bot_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if private chats with bots can be chosen

fields.name: allow_group_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if group and supergroup chats can be chosen

fields.name: allow_channel_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if channel chats can be chosen

types.name: CopyTextButton
types.description: This object represents an inline keyboard button that copies specified text to the clipboard.

fields.name: text
fields.description: The text to be copied to the clipboard; 1-256 characters

types.name: CallbackQuery
types.description: This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an inline keyboard. If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field message will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in inline mode), the field inline_message_id will be present. Exactly one of the fields data or game_short_name will be present.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this query

fields.name: from
fields.description: Sender

fields.name: message
fields.description: Optional. Message sent by the bot with the callback button that originated the query

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.

fields.name: chat_instance
fields.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in games.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Optional. Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that the message originated the query can contain no callback buttons with this data.

fields.name: game_short_name
fields.description: Optional. Short name of a Game to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game

types.notes: NOTE: After the user presses a callback button, Telegram clients will display a progress bar until you call answerCallbackQuery. It is, therefore, necessary to react by calling answerCallbackQuery even if no notification to the user is needed (e.g., without specifying any of the optional parameters).

types.name: ForceReply
types.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice privacy mode. Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: force_reply
fields.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'

fields.name: input_field_placeholder
fields.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters

fields.name: selective
fields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.

types.notes:
Example: A poll bot for groups runs in privacy mode (only receives commands, replies to its messages and mentions). There could be two ways to create a new poll:

  • Explain the user how to send a command with parameters (e.g. /newpoll question answer1 answer2). May be appealing for hardcore users but lacks modern day polish.
  • Guide the user through a step-by-step process. 'Please send me your question', 'Cool, now let's add the first answer option', 'Great. Keep adding answer options, then send /done when you're ready'.

The last option is definitely more attractive. And if you use ForceReply in your bot's questions, it will receive the user's answers even if it only receives replies, commands and mentions - without any extra work for the user.

types.name: ChatPhoto

fields.name: small_file_unique_id

fields.name: big_file_id

fields.name: big_file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: can_delete_messages

fields.name: can_manage_video_chats

fields.name: can_restrict_members

fields.name: can_promote_members

fields.name: can_change_info
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

fields.name: can_invite_users

fields.name: can_post_stories

fields.name: can_delete_stories

fields.name: can_post_messages

fields.name: can_edit_messages

fields.name: can_pin_messages

fields.name: can_manage_topics

fields.name: can_manage_direct_messages

This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 5 minutes to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.

fields.description: Scope type, must be default

types.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all private chats.

fields.description: Scope type, must be all_private_chats

fields.description: Scope type, must be all_group_chats

fields.description: Scope type, must be all_chat_administrators

fields.description: Scope type, must be chat

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername). Channel direct messages chats and channel chats aren't supported.

types.name: BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be chat_administrators

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername). Channel direct messages chats and channel chats aren't supported.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be chat_member

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername). Channel direct messages chats and channel chats aren't supported.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user

Alternatively, a t.me link to a Web App of the bot can be specified in the object instead of the Web App's URL, in which case the Web App will be opened as if the user pressed the link.

types.name: ResponseParameters
types.description: Describes why a request was unsuccessful.

This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

types.name: InputMedia
types.description: This object represents the content of a media message to be sent. It should be one of

types.name: InputMediaPhoto
types.description: Represents a photo to be sent.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be photo

fields.name: media
fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files »

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: show_caption_above_media
fields.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

fields.name: has_spoiler
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the photo needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

types.name: InputMediaVideo
types.description: Represents a video to be sent.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be video

fields.name: media
fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files »

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files »

fields.name: cover
fields.description: Optional. Cover for the video in the message. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files »

fields.name: start_timestamp
fields.description: Optional. Start timestamp for the video in the message

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: show_caption_above_media
fields.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.description: Type of the sticker, currently one of “regular”, “mask”, “custom_emoji”. The type of the sticker is independent from its format, which is determined by the fields is_animated and is_video.

fields.name: height
fields.description: Sticker height

fields.description: True, if the sticker is animated

fields.description: True, if the sticker is a video sticker

fields.description: Optional. Sticker thumbnail in the .WEBP or .JPG format

fields.name: emoji
fields.description: Optional. Emoji associated with the sticker

fields.name: set_name
fields.description: Optional. Name of the sticker set to which the sticker belongs

fields.name: premium_animation
fields.description: Optional. For premium regular stickers, premium animation for the sticker

fields.name: mask_position
fields.description: Optional. For mask stickers, the position where the mask should be placed

fields.name: custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. For custom emoji stickers, unique identifier of the custom emoji

fields.name: needs_repainting
fields.description: Optional. True, if the sticker must be repainted to a text color in messages, the color of the Telegram Premium badge in emoji status, white color on chat photos, or another appropriate color in other places

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes

fields.description: Optional. Sticker set thumbnail in the .WEBP, .TGS, or .WEBM format

types.name: MaskPosition
types.description: This object describes the position on faces where a mask should be placed by default.

fields.name: point
fields.description: The part of the face relative to which the mask should be placed. One of “forehead”, “eyes”, “mouth”, or “chin”.

fields.name: x_shift
fields.description: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. For example, choosing -1.0 will place mask just to the left of the default mask position.

fields.name: y_shift
fields.description: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position.

fields.name: scale
fields.description: Mask scaling coefficient. For example, 2.0 means double size.

types.name: InputSticker
types.description: This object describes a sticker to be added to a sticker set.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: The added sticker. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new file using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. Animated and video stickers can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. More information on Sending Files »

fields.name: format
fields.description: Format of the added sticker, must be one of “static” for a .WEBP or .PNG image, “animated” for a .TGS animation, “video” for a .WEBM video

fields.name: emoji_list
fields.description: List of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker

fields.name: mask_position
fields.description: Optional. Position where the mask should be placed on faces. For “mask” stickers only.

fields.name: keywords
fields.description: Optional. List of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters. For “regular” and “custom_emoji” stickers only.

types.name: InlineQuery
types.description: This object represents an incoming inline query. When the user sends an empty query, your bot could return some default or trending results.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this query

fields.name: from
fields.description: Sender

fields.name: query
fields.description: Text of the query (up to 256 characters)

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Offset of the results to be returned, can be controlled by the bot

fields.name: chat_type
fields.description: Optional. Type of the chat from which the inline query was sent. Can be either “sender” for a private chat with the inline query sender, “private”, “group”, “supergroup”, or “channel”. The chat type should be always known for requests sent from official clients and most third-party clients, unless the request was sent from a secret chat

fields.name: location
fields.description: Optional. Sender location, only for bots that request user location

types.name: InlineQueryResultsButton
types.description: This object represents a button to be shown above inline query results. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Label text on the button

fields.name: web_app
fields.description: Optional. Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to switch back to the inline mode using the method switchInlineQuery inside the Web App.

fields.name: start_parameter
fields.description:
Optional. Deep-linking parameter for the /start message sent to the bot when a user presses the button. 1-64 characters, only A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed.

Example: An inline bot that sends YouTube videos can ask the user to connect the bot to their YouTube account to adapt search results accordingly. To do this, it displays a 'Connect your YouTube account' button above the results, or even before showing any. The user presses the button, switches to a private chat with the bot and, in doing so, passes a start parameter that instructs the bot to return an OAuth link. Once done, the bot can offer a switch_inline button so that the user can easily return to the chat where they wanted to use the bot's inline capabilities.

types.name: InputMessageContent
types.description: This object represents the content of a message to be sent as a result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support the following 5 types:

fields.name: parse_mode

fields.name: entities
fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: link_preview_options
fields.description: Optional. Link preview generation options for the message

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Longitude of the location in degrees

fields.name: horizontal_accuracy
fields.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

fields.name: live_period
fields.description: Optional. Period in seconds during which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400, or 0x7FFFFFFF for live locations that can be edited indefinitely.

fields.name: heading
fields.description: Optional. For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

fields.name: proximity_alert_radius
fields.description: Optional. For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

types.name: InputVenueMessageContent

fields.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

fields.name: google_place_id
fields.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

fields.name: google_place_type
fields.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

types.name: InputContactMessageContent
types.description: Represents the content of a contact message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

fields.name: phone_number
fields.description: Contact's phone number

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: Contact's first name

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. Contact's last name

fields.name: vcard
fields.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard, 0-2048 bytes

types.name: InputInvoiceMessageContent
types.description: Represents the content of an invoice message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

fields.name: description
fields.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use it for your internal processes.

fields.name: provider_token
fields.description: Optional. Payment provider token, obtained via @BotFather. Pass an empty string for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies. Pass “XTR” for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: prices
fields.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.). Must contain exactly one item for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: max_tip_amount
fields.description: Optional. The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0. Not supported for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: suggested_tip_amounts
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tip in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

fields.name: provider_data
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object for data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of the required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

fields.name: photo_url
fields.description: Optional. URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service.

fields.name: photo_size
fields.description: Optional. Photo size in bytes

fields.name: photo_width
fields.description: Optional. Photo width

fields.name: photo_height
fields.description: Optional. Photo height

fields.name: need_name
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_phone_number
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_email
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_shipping_address
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: send_email_to_provider
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: is_flexible
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

types.name: ChosenInlineResult
types.description: Represents a result of an inline query that was chosen by the user and sent to their chat partner.

fields.name: result_id

fields.description: The user that chose the result

fields.name: location
fields.description: Optional. Sender location, only for bots that require user location

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the sent inline message. Available only if there is an inline keyboard attached to the message. Will be also received in callback queries and can be used to edit the message.

fields.name: query
fields.description: The query that was used to obtain the result

types.notes: Note: It is necessary to enable inline feedback via @BotFather in order to receive these objects in updates.

fields.name: commission_per_mille
fields.description: The number of Telegram Stars received by the affiliate for each 1000 Telegram Stars received by the bot from referred users

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Integer amount of Telegram Stars received by the affiliate from the transaction, rounded to 0; can be negative for refunds

fields.name: nanostar_amount
fields.description: Optional. The number of 1/1000000000 shares of Telegram Stars received by the affiliate; from -999999999 to 999999999; can be negative for refunds

types.name: TransactionPartner
types.description: This object describes the source of a transaction, or its recipient for outgoing transactions. Currently, it can be one of

types.name: TransactionPartnerUser
types.description: Describes a transaction with a user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “user”

fields.name: transaction_type
fields.description: Type of the transaction, currently one of “invoice_payment” for payments via invoices, “paid_media_payment” for payments for paid media, “gift_purchase” for gifts sent by the bot, “premium_purchase” for Telegram Premium subscriptions gifted by the bot, “business_account_transfer” for direct transfers from managed business accounts

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

fields.name: affiliate
fields.description: Optional. Information about the affiliate that received a commission via this transaction. Can be available only for “invoice_payment” and “paid_media_payment” transactions.

fields.name: invoice_payload
fields.description: Optional. Bot-specified invoice payload. Can be available only for “invoice_payment” transactions.

fields.name: subscription_period
fields.description: Optional. The duration of the paid subscription. Can be available only for “invoice_payment” transactions.

fields.name: paid_media
fields.description: Optional. Information about the paid media bought by the user; for “paid_media_payment” transactions only

fields.name: paid_media_payload
fields.description: Optional. Bot-specified paid media payload. Can be available only for “paid_media_payment” transactions.

fields.name: gift
fields.description: Optional. The gift sent to the user by the bot; for “gift_purchase” transactions only

fields.name: premium_subscription_duration
fields.description: Optional. Number of months the gifted Telegram Premium subscription will be active for; for “premium_purchase” transactions only

types.name: TransactionPartnerChat
types.description: Describes a transaction with a chat.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “chat”

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Information about the chat

fields.name: gift
fields.description: Optional. The gift sent to the chat by the bot

types.name: TransactionPartnerAffiliateProgram
types.description: Describes the affiliate program that issued the affiliate commission received via this transaction.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “affiliate_program”

fields.name: sponsor_user
fields.description: Optional. Information about the bot that sponsored the affiliate program

fields.name: commission_per_mille
fields.description: The number of Telegram Stars received by the bot for each 1000 Telegram Stars received by the affiliate program sponsor from referred users

types.name: TransactionPartnerFragment
types.description: Describes a withdrawal transaction with Fragment.

fields.name: withdrawal_state

types.name: TransactionPartnerTelegramAds

types.name: TransactionPartnerTelegramApi

fields.name: request_count
fields.description: The number of successful requests that exceeded regular limits and were therefore billed

types.name: TransactionPartnerOther
types.description: Describes a transaction with an unknown source or recipient.

fields.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “other”

types.name: StarTransaction
types.description: Describes a Telegram Star transaction. Note that if the buyer initiates a chargeback with the payment provider from whom they acquired Stars (e.g., Apple, Google) following this transaction, the refunded Stars will be deducted from the bot's balance. This is outside of Telegram's control.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the transaction. Coincides with the identifier of the original transaction for refund transactions. Coincides with SuccessfulPayment.telegram_payment_charge_id for successful incoming payments from users.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Integer amount of Telegram Stars transferred by the transaction

fields.name: nanostar_amount
fields.description: Optional. The number of 1/1000000000 shares of Telegram Stars transferred by the transaction; from 0 to 999999999

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the transaction was created in Unix time

fields.name: source
fields.description: Optional. Source of an incoming transaction (e.g., a user purchasing goods or services, Fragment refunding a failed withdrawal). Only for incoming transactions

fields.name: receiver
fields.description: Optional. Receiver of an outgoing transaction (e.g., a user for a purchase refund, Fragment for a withdrawal). Only for outgoing transactions

types.name: StarTransactions
types.description: Contains a list of Telegram Star transactions.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: The list of transactions

types.name: PassportData

fields.name: credentials
fields.description: Encrypted credentials required to decrypt the data

types.name: PassportFile
types.description: This object represents a file uploaded to Telegram Passport. Currently all Telegram Passport files are in JPEG format when decrypted and don't exceed 10MB.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: File size in bytes

fields.name: file_date
fields.description: Unix time when the file was uploaded

types.name: EncryptedPassportElement
types.description: Describes documents or other Telegram Passport elements shared with the bot by the user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Element type. One of “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “address”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”, “phone_number”, “email”.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Optional. Base64-encoded encrypted Telegram Passport element data provided by the user; available only for “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport” and “address” types. Can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: phone_number
fields.description: Optional. User's verified phone number; available only for “phone_number” type

fields.name: email
fields.description: Optional. User's verified email address; available only for “email” type

fields.name: files
fields.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with documents provided by the user; available only for “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: front_side
fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the front side of the document, provided by the user; available only for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: reverse_side
fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the reverse side of the document, provided by the user; available only for “driver_license” and “identity_card”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: selfie
fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the selfie of the user holding a document, provided by the user; available if requested for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: translation
fields.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with translated versions of documents provided by the user; available if requested for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: Base64-encoded element hash for using in PassportElementErrorUnspecified

types.name: EncryptedCredentials
types.description: Describes data required for decrypting and authenticating EncryptedPassportElement. See the Telegram Passport Documentation for a complete description of the data decryption and authentication processes.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Base64-encoded encrypted JSON-serialized data with unique user's payload, data hashes and secrets required for EncryptedPassportElement decryption and authentication

fields.name: hash
fields.description: Base64-encoded data hash for data authentication

fields.name: secret
fields.description: Base64-encoded secret, encrypted with the bot's public RSA key, required for data decryption
