methods.name: approveSuggestedPost
methods.description: Use this method to approve a suggested post in a direct messages chat. The bot must have the 'can_post_messages' administrator right in the corresponding channel chat. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target direct messages chat

params.name: message_id
params.description: Identifier of a suggested post message to approve

params.name: send_date
params.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the post is expected to be published; omit if the date has already been specified when the suggested post was created. If specified, then the date must be not more than 2678400 seconds (30 days) in the future

methods.name: declineSuggestedPost
methods.description: Use this method to decline a suggested post in a direct messages chat. The bot must have the 'can_manage_direct_messages' administrator right in the corresponding channel chat. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target direct messages chat

params.name: message_id
params.description: Identifier of a suggested post message to decline

params.name: comment
params.description: Comment for the creator of the suggested post; 0-128 characters

methods.name: deleteMessage
methods.description:
Use this method to delete a message, including service messages, with the following limitations:
- A message can only be deleted if it was sent less than 48 hours ago.
- Service messages about a supergroup, channel, or forum topic creation can't be deleted.
- A dice message in a private chat can only be deleted if it was sent more than 24 hours ago.
- Bots can delete outgoing messages in private chats, groups, and supergroups.
- Bots can delete incoming messages in private chats.
- Bots granted can_post_messages permissions can delete outgoing messages in channels.
- If the bot is an administrator of a group, it can delete any message there.
- If the bot has can_delete_messages administrator right in a supergroup or a channel, it can delete any message there.
- If the bot has can_manage_direct_messages administrator right in a channel, it can delete any message in the corresponding direct messages chat.
Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Identifier of the message to delete

methods.name: deleteMessages
methods.description: Use this method to delete multiple messages simultaneously. If some of the specified messages can't be found, they are skipped. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_ids
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-100 identifiers of messages to delete. See deleteMessage for limitations on which messages can be deleted

methods.name: sendSticker
methods.description: Use this method to send static .WEBP, animated .TGS, or video .WEBM stickers. On success, the sent Message is returned.

params.name: business_connection_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_thread_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of a forum; for forum supergroups and private chats of bots with forum topic mode enabled only

params.name: direct_messages_topic_id
params.description: Identifier of the direct messages topic to which the message will be sent; required if the message is sent to a direct messages chat

params.name: sticker
params.description: Sticker to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a .WEBP sticker from the Internet, or upload a new .WEBP, .TGS, or .WEBM sticker using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files ». Video and animated stickers can't be sent via an HTTP URL.

params.name: emoji
params.description: Emoji associated with the sticker; only for just uploaded stickers

params.name: disable_notification
params.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

params.name: protect_content
params.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

params.name: allow_paid_broadcast
params.description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance

params.name: message_effect_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only

params.name: suggested_post_parameters
params.description: A JSON-serialized object containing the parameters of the suggested post to send; for direct messages chats only. If the message is sent as a reply to another suggested post, then that suggested post is automatically declined.

params.name: reply_parameters
params.description: Description of the message to reply to

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove a reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user

methods.name: getStickerSet
methods.description: Use this method to get a sticker set. On success, a StickerSet object is returned.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the sticker set

methods.name: getCustomEmojiStickers
methods.description: Use this method to get information about custom emoji stickers by their identifiers. Returns an Array of Sticker objects.

params.name: custom_emoji_ids
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of custom emoji identifiers. At most 200 custom emoji identifiers can be specified.

methods.name: uploadStickerFile
methods.description: Use this method to upload a file with a sticker for later use in the createNewStickerSet, addStickerToSet, or replaceStickerInSet methods (the file can be used multiple times). Returns the uploaded File on success.

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier of sticker file owner

params.name: sticker
params.description: A file with the sticker in .WEBP, .PNG, .TGS, or .WEBM format. See https://core.telegram.org/stickers for technical requirements. More information on Sending Files »

params.name: sticker_format
params.description: Format of the sticker, must be one of “static”, “animated”, “video”

methods.name: createNewStickerSet
methods.description: Use this method to create a new sticker set owned by a user. The bot will be able to edit the sticker set thus created. Returns True on success.

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier of created sticker set owner

params.name: name
params.description: Short name of sticker set, to be used in t.me/addstickers/ URLs (e.g., animals). Can contain only English letters, digits and underscores. Must begin with a letter, can't contain consecutive underscores and must end in "_by_<bot_username>". <bot_username> is case insensitive. 1-64 characters.

params.name: title
params.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

params.name: stickers
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-50 initial stickers to be added to the sticker set

params.name: sticker_type
params.description: Type of stickers in the set, pass “regular”, “mask”, or “custom_emoji”. By default, a regular sticker set is created.

params.name: needs_repainting
params.description: Pass True if stickers in the sticker set must be repainted to the color of text when used in messages, the accent color if used as emoji status, white on chat photos, or another appropriate color based on context; for custom emoji sticker sets only

methods.name: addStickerToSet
methods.description: Use this method to add a new sticker to a set created by the bot. Emoji sticker sets can have up to 200 stickers. Other sticker sets can have up to 120 stickers. Returns True on success.

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier of sticker set owner

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

params.name: sticker
params.description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set isn't changed.

methods.name: setStickerPositionInSet
methods.description: Use this method to move a sticker in a set created by the bot to a specific position. Returns True on success.

params.name: sticker
params.description: File identifier of the sticker

params.name: position
params.description: New sticker position in the set, zero-based

methods.name: deleteStickerFromSet
methods.description: Use this method to delete a sticker from a set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: sticker
params.description: File identifier of the sticker

methods.name: replaceStickerInSet
methods.description: Use this method to replace an existing sticker in a sticker set with a new one. The method is equivalent to calling deleteStickerFromSet, then addStickerToSet, then setStickerPositionInSet. Returns True on success.

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

params.name: old_sticker
params.description: File identifier of the replaced sticker

params.name: sticker
params.description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set remains unchanged.

methods.name: setStickerEmojiList
methods.description: Use this method to change the list of emoji assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: sticker
params.description: File identifier of the sticker

params.name: emoji_list
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker

methods.name: setStickerKeywords
methods.description: Use this method to change search keywords assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: sticker
params.description: File identifier of the sticker

params.name: keywords
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters

methods.name: setStickerMaskPosition
methods.description: Use this method to change the mask position of a mask sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set that was created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: sticker
params.description: File identifier of the sticker

params.name: mask_position
params.description: A JSON-serialized object with the position where the mask should be placed on faces. Omit the parameter to remove the mask position.

methods.name: setStickerSetTitle
methods.description: Use this method to set the title of a created sticker set. Returns True on success.

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

params.name: title
params.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

methods.name: setStickerSetThumbnail
methods.description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a regular or mask sticker set. The format of the thumbnail file must match the format of the stickers in the set. Returns True on success.

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

params.name: thumbnail
params.description: A .WEBP or .PNG image with the thumbnail, must be up to 128 kilobytes in size and have a width and height of exactly 100px, or a .TGS animation with a thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size (see https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animation-requirements for animated sticker technical requirements), or a .WEBM video with the thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size; see https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-requirements for video sticker technical requirements. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files ». Animated and video sticker set thumbnails can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. If omitted, then the thumbnail is dropped and the first sticker is used as the thumbnail.

params.name: format
params.description: Format of the thumbnail, must be one of “static” for a .WEBP or .PNG image, “animated” for a .TGS animation, or “video” for a .WEBM video

methods.name: setCustomEmojiStickerSetThumbnail
methods.description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a custom emoji sticker set. Returns True on success.

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

params.name: custom_emoji_id
params.description: Custom emoji identifier of a sticker from the sticker set; pass an empty string to drop the thumbnail and use the first sticker as the thumbnail.

methods.name: deleteStickerSet
methods.description: Use this method to delete a sticker set that was created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

methods.name: answerInlineQuery
methods.description:
Use this method to send answers to an inline query. On success, True is returned.
No more than 50 results per query are allowed.

params.name: inline_query_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the answered query

params.name: results
params.description: A JSON-serialized array of results for the inline query

params.name: cache_time
params.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.

params.name: is_personal
params.description: Pass True if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query.

params.name: next_offset
params.description: Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don't support pagination. Offset length can't exceed 64 bytes.

params.name: button
params.description: A JSON-serialized object describing a button to be shown above inline query results

methods.name: answerWebAppQuery
methods.description: Use this method to set the result of an interaction with a Web App and send a corresponding message on behalf of the user to the chat from which the query originated. On success, a SentWebAppMessage object is returned.

params.name: web_app_query_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

params.name: result
params.description: A JSON-serialized object describing the message to be sent

methods.name: savePreparedInlineMessage
methods.description: Stores a message that can be sent by a user of a Mini App. Returns a PreparedInlineMessage object.

params.name: user_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target user that can use the prepared message

params.name: result
params.description: A JSON-serialized object describing the message to be sent

params.name: allow_user_chats
params.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to private chats with users

params.name: allow_bot_chats
params.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to private chats with bots

params.name: allow_group_chats
params.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to group and supergroup chats

params.name: allow_channel_chats
params.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to channel chats

methods.name: sendInvoice
methods.description: Use this method to send invoices. On success, the sent Message is returned.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_thread_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of a forum; for forum supergroups and private chats of bots with forum topic mode enabled only

params.name: direct_messages_topic_id
params.description: Identifier of the direct messages topic to which the message will be sent; required if the message is sent to a direct messages chat

params.name: title
params.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

params.name: description
params.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

params.name: payload
params.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use it for your internal processes.

params.name: provider_token
params.description: Payment provider token, obtained via @BotFather. Pass an empty string for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: currency
params.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies. Pass “XTR” for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: prices
params.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.). Must contain exactly one item for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: max_tip_amount
params.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0. Not supported for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: suggested_tip_amounts
params.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

params.name: start_parameter
params.description: Unique deep-linking parameter. If left empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a Pay button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice. If non-empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a URL button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a Pay button), with the value used as the start parameter

params.name: provider_data
params.description: JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

params.name: photo_url
params.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

params.name: photo_size
params.description: Photo size in bytes

params.name: photo_width
params.description: Photo width

params.name: photo_height
params.description: Photo height

params.name: need_name
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: need_phone_number
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: need_email
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: need_shipping_address
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
params.description: Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: send_email_to_provider
params.description: Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: is_flexible
params.description: Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: disable_notification
params.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

params.name: protect_content
params.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

params.name: allow_paid_broadcast
params.description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance

params.name: message_effect_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only

params.name: suggested_post_parameters
params.description: A JSON-serialized object containing the parameters of the suggested post to send; for direct messages chats only. If the message is sent as a reply to another suggested post, then that suggested post is automatically declined.

params.name: reply_parameters
params.description: Description of the message to reply to

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Pay total price' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must be a Pay button.

methods.name: createInvoiceLink
methods.description: Use this method to create a link for an invoice. Returns the created invoice link as String on success.

params.name: business_connection_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the link will be created. For payments in Telegram Stars only.

params.name: title
params.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

params.name: description
params.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

params.name: payload
params.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use it for your internal processes.

params.name: provider_token
params.description: Payment provider token, obtained via @BotFather. Pass an empty string for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: currency
params.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies. Pass “XTR” for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: prices
params.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.). Must contain exactly one item for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: subscription_period
params.description: The number of seconds the subscription will be active for before the next payment. The currency must be set to “XTR” (Telegram Stars) if the parameter is used. Currently, it must always be 2592000 (30 days) if specified. Any number of subscriptions can be active for a given bot at the same time, including multiple concurrent subscriptions from the same user. Subscription price must no exceed 10000 Telegram Stars.

params.name: max_tip_amount
params.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0. Not supported for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: suggested_tip_amounts
params.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

params.name: provider_data
params.description: JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

params.name: photo_url
params.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service.

params.name: photo_size
params.description: Photo size in bytes

params.name: photo_width
params.description: Photo width

params.name: photo_height
params.description: Photo height

params.name: need_name
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: need_phone_number
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: need_email
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: need_shipping_address
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
params.description: Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: send_email_to_provider
params.description: Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

params.name: is_flexible
params.description: Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

methods.name: answerShippingQuery
methods.description: If you sent an invoice requesting a shipping address and the parameter is_flexible was specified, the Bot API will send an Update with a shipping_query field to the bot. Use this method to reply to shipping queries. On success, True is returned.

params.name: shipping_query_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

params.name: ok
params.description: Pass True if delivery to the specified address is possible and False if there are any problems (for example, if delivery to the specified address is not possible)

params.name: shipping_options
params.description: Required if ok is True. A JSON-serialized array of available shipping options.

params.name: error_message
params.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. “Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable”). Telegram will display this message to the user.

methods.name: answerPreCheckoutQuery
methods.description: Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the Bot API sends the final confirmation in the form of an Update with the field pre_checkout_query. Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries. On success, True is returned. Note: The Bot API must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.

params.name: pre_checkout_query_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

params.name: ok
params.description: Specify True if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order. Use False if there are any problems.

params.name: error_message
params.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

methods.name: getMyStarBalance
methods.description: A method to get the current Telegram Stars balance of the bot. Requires no parameters. On success, returns a StarAmount object.

methods.name: getStarTransactions
methods.description: Returns the bot's Telegram Star transactions in chronological order. On success, returns a StarTransactions object.

params.name: offset
params.description: Number of transactions to skip in the response

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of transactions to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

methods.name: refundStarPayment
methods.description: Refunds a successful payment in Telegram Stars. Returns True on success.

params.name: user_id
params.description: Identifier of the user whose payment will be refunded

params.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
params.description: Telegram payment identifier

methods.name: editUserStarSubscription
methods.description: Allows the bot to cancel or re-enable extension of a subscription paid in Telegram Stars. Returns True on success.

params.name: user_id
params.description: Identifier of the user whose subscription will be edited

params.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
params.description: Telegram payment identifier for the subscription

params.name: is_canceled
params.description: Pass True to cancel extension of the user subscription; the subscription must be active up to the end of the current subscription period. Pass False to allow the user to re-enable a subscription that was previously canceled by the bot.

methods.name: setPassportDataErrors
methods.description:
Informs a user that some of the Telegram Passport elements they provided contains errors. The user will not be able to re-submit their Passport to you until the errors are fixed (the contents of the field for which you returned the error must change). Returns True on success.

Use this if the data submitted by the user doesn't satisfy the standards your service requires for any reason. For example, if a birthday date seems invalid, a submitted document is blurry, a scan shows evidence of tampering, etc. Supply some details in the error message to make sure the user knows how to correct the issues.

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier

params.name: errors
params.description: A JSON-serialized array describing the errors

methods.name: sendGame
methods.description: Use this method to send a game. On success, the sent Message is returned.

params.name: business_connection_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat. Games can't be sent to channel direct messages chats and channel chats.

params.name: message_thread_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of a forum; for forum supergroups and private chats of bots with forum topic mode enabled only

params.name: game_short_name
params.description: Short name of the game, serves as the unique identifier for the game. Set up your games via @BotFather.

params.name: disable_notification
params.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

params.name: protect_content
params.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

params.name: allow_paid_broadcast
params.description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance

params.name: message_effect_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only

params.name: reply_parameters
params.description: Description of the message to reply to

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Play game_title' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must launch the game.

methods.name: setGameScore
methods.description: Use this method to set the score of the specified user in a game message. On success, if the message is not an inline message, the Message is returned, otherwise True is returned. Returns an error, if the new score is not greater than the user's current score in the chat and force is False.

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier

params.name: score
params.description: New score, must be non-negative

params.name: force
params.description: Pass True if the high score is allowed to decrease. This can be useful when fixing mistakes or banning cheaters

params.name: disable_edit_message
params.description: Pass True if the game message should not be automatically edited to include the current scoreboard

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

params.name: message_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

params.name: inline_message_id
params.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

methods.name: getGameHighScores
methods.description:
Use this method to get data for high score tables. Will return the score of the specified user and several of their neighbors in a game. Returns an Array of GameHighScore objects.

This method will currently return scores for the target user, plus two of their closest neighbors on each side. Will also return the top three users if the user and their neighbors are not among them. Please note that this behavior is subject to change.

params.name: user_id
params.description: Target user id

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

params.name: message_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

params.name: inline_message_id
params.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message
